result.execSummary:
The defendant Demario Latrell Rucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid during probation period on 14CF1748, if revoked on 14CF1748 to be paid from 25% of prison funds during initial confinement and then to be collected during extended supervision, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

TIME SERVED DISPOSTION.
Consecutive to: to case 13CF5536. This sentence is concurrent to 13CF5536, but consecutive to all other cases
Defendant advised of firearm possession ban

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demario Latrell Rucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to SUPERINTENDENT SKALSKI ST CROIX CORRECTIONAL CTR P.O.BOX 36 NEW RICHMOND WI 54017-0036

INVOICE 
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $437.50 to Dr. Pankiewicz for services on 04-15, 04-22, 04-23 & 04-24-14.
COPY IN FILE.

Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.  Court reviewed photos and returned to state. Additional statements by defendant's sister.
COUNT 1
Court sentenced the defendant to 179 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to case 13CF5536, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. This sentence is concurrent to 13CF5536, but consecutive to all other cases. Court ordered the defendant to pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid during probation period on 14CF1748, if revoked on 14CF1748 to be paid from 25% of prison funds during initial confinement and then to be collected during extended supervision, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Defendant advised of right to seek post conviction relief, form filed. Defendant advised of firearm possession ban.
Received & Filed, Amended Information (reflects oral amendments previously made to Count 1)

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.Discussion regarding defendant's communication privileges. Court did NOT modify restriction, but will allow for in person visitation from defendant's mother if order is submitted to the court. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in custody.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled.
Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court amended Count 1 to Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.019(1), 968.075(1)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Demario Latrell Rucker not in court, in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. 1st call, case set for Jury Trial. Discussion regarding case. Case passed to allow court to address calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, State's Brief on Forfeiture By Wrongdoing.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Demario Latrell Rucker not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  efendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. State's offer is withdrawn as of today's date. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 07/28/2014.
Signed, & Filed, Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Demario Latrell Rucker not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. State's motion for joinder granted over defense objection. Defense counsel WAIVED speedy trial demand until Jury Trial date.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing MAY 6, 2014 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Terese Dick - SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jon Duchateau-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF5536 that are attached to the complaint. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Doctor's Report.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report. Discussion as to Competency Report, reviewed by court. Defendant was found to be competent to proceed, state and defense do not contest findings of the report.  Court reinstated proceedings. Discussion regarding letter submitted by Dr. Pankiewicz. Additional documentation needed to complete NGI evaluation, parties to provide additional information to Dr. Pankiewicz Case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing to branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Letter from Dr. John Pankiewicz.
Received & Filed, Doctor's Report.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Demario Latrell Rucker not in court, in custody.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties argued bail. Bail set at $4,000.00 CASH. Court did reinstated defendant's $750.00 previously forfeited. Defendant needs to post the balance to be released.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Defense counsel further advised the court that defense will be proceeding with an NGI theory and requested Dr. Pankowicz to administer the evaluation. Signed & Filed, CR-270 (NGI). Case adjourned for Return on Doctor's report as to Competency and NGI plea in branch 23.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 3/4/2014 at 2:00AM
Bench warrant in file. Case set for Return of Warrant on 03/13/2014 at 1:30 pm in branch 23. All parties advised.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court previously in court.  Peter M. Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Calendar Call. Defendant NOT in court. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered bail forfeited pending restitution, held for restitution and recompense.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court.  Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
Matter set for prelimary hearing.  Counsel informed the Court the defendant has serious health issues and was just released from the hospital.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for calendar call on 2/28/14 at 8:30 in Branch 23.  Calendar call scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM008033  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/16/14 vf
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Demario Latrell Rucker in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
